bug.author: JulianGerhard21
bug.summary: NER WIP: ValueError: could not broadcast input array from shape (10,10) into shape (10,64)
bug.description:
Spacy: 2.2.2 Thinc: 7.3.1 spacy-transformers: 0.5.0/feature/ner Python: 3.6.8 Model: de_trf_bertbasecased_lg Hi, the finetuning/training process ends successfull after modifying the samples sentences to german. The entities are properly printed afterwards. If output_dir is specified and the script tries to load the model, the following error with full stacktrace occurs: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "bert_finetuner_splitset.py", line 324, in <module> plac.call(main) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\plac_core.py", line 367, in call cmd, result = parser.consume(arglist) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\plac_core.py", line 232, in consume return cmd, self.func(*(args + varargs + extraopts), **kwargs) File "bert_finetuner_splitset.py", line 64, in main nlp = spacy.load(model) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\__init__.py", line 30, in load return util.load_model(name, **overrides) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\util.py", line 215, in load_model return load_model_from_package(name, **overrides) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\util.py", line 236, in load_model_from_package return cls.load(**overrides) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\de_trf_bertbasecased_lg_ner\__init__.py", line 12, in load return load_model_from_init_py(__file__, **overrides) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\util.py", line 279, in load_model_from_init_py return load_model_from_path(data_path, meta, **overrides) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\util.py", line 262, in load_model_from_path return nlp.from_disk(model_path) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\language.py", line 940, in from_disk util.from_disk(path, deserializers, exclude) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\util.py", line 733, in from_disk reader(path / key) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages\spacy\language.py", line 935, in <lambda> p, exclude=["vocab"] File "nn_parser.pyx", line 663, in spacy.syntax.nn_parser.Parser.from_disk File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages	hinc
eural\_classes\model.py", line 376, in from_bytes copy_array(dest, param[b"value"]) File "C:\Users\JulianGerhard\Envs
er_env\lib\site-packages	hinc
eural\util.py", line 145, in copy_array dst[:] = src ValueError: could not broadcast input array from shape (10,10) into shape (10,64) </denchmark-code>
What can be done here? Regards

comments.comment: I just read <denchmark-link:https://support.prodi.gy/t/could-not-broadcast-input-array-from-shape-96-into-shape-128/1441/2>this post for prodigy</denchmark-link> and thought I should mention, that I downloaded the model with the current spacy version. TYPE NAME MODEL VERSION package de-trf-bertbasecased-lg de_trf_bertbasecased_lg 2.2.0 âœ”
Could you try v0.5.1? I think it might be fixed.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/honnibal>@honnibal</denchmark-link>
I tried that by first merging the 0.5.1 master branch into the feature/ner (since installing that one told me that it was version 0.5.0). During the merge tok2vec and model_registry needed to be merged manually. After doing that with a "best-guess" strategy (taking the feature/ner content mostly), I retrained and the error still occurs. Feel free to ask for more tests if useful for you. Regards

Perhaps this is a similar issue as the one in Issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spacy-transformers/issues/105>#105</denchmark-link> and which PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spacy-transformers/pull/120>#120</denchmark-link> aims to address. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/JulianGerhard21>@JulianGerhard21</denchmark-link> : can you provide the content of the file in your directory (specifically the part near the end)?

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to a request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, there's not enough information to take action. If you're the original author, feel free to reopen the issue if you have or find the answers needed to investigate further.
